solution_line_template: If Alice has {alice_pens} pens, Clara {clara_pens_fraction}*{alice_pens}=<<{clara_pens}={clara_pens}>>{clara_pens} pens.
The number of pens that Alice has more than Clara is {alice_pens}-{clara_pens}=<<{alice_pens}-{clara_pens}={pen_difference}>>{pen_difference}

Since Alice is {alice_age}, and the number of pens that Alice has more than Clara is their age difference, Clara is {alice_age}+{pen_difference}=<<{alice_age}+{pen_difference}={clara_current_age}>>{clara_current_age} years old.
In five years, Clara's age will be {clara_current_age}+{years_to_add}=<<{clara_current_age}+{years_to_add}={clara_age_in_five_years}>>{clara_age_in_five_years} years.
